nodes.text: Ruusan was a planet located in the Ruusan system within the Teraab sector of the galaxy's Mid Rim that was orbited by three moons. It was positioned at the coordinates P-11 of the Standard Galactic Grid. During the Separatist Crisis, it was aligned with the Confederacy of Independent Systems, and, during the Clone Wars, one of its moons was the location of Skytop Station, a secret Separatist listening post. Ruusan was host to a number of ancient relics, strewn across its many historical battlefields.
The planet shared its name with the Ruusan Reformations, an event of governmental reform in the Galactic Republic.

Ruusan made its first appearance in Star Wars canon in "Duel of the Droids," the seventh episode of the animated television series Star Wars: The Clone Wars' first season, which originally aired on November 14, 2008.

The planet was originally created for the Star Wars Legends video game Star Wars: Jedi Knight: Dark Forces II, where it played a prominent role as the location of the powerful Force nexus known as the Valley of the Jedi. In Legends, it was later revealed as the site of the final battle of the New Sith Wars, which served as the catalyst for the Ruusan Reformation that reorganized the Galactic Republic.
The 2017 reference book Star Wars: The Visual Encyclopedia mistakenly depicts Ruusan using an image of the Ruusan moon.
